titleStmt.title: On the Death of the Regent of France.

publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: How vain are mortall Mans endeavours!
(Said at Dame Elliots, Master T────rs)
Good Orleans dead! In truth its hard,
O may all Statesmen dye prepard!
Ah Friends, great Changes threat the Land,
All France & England at a Stand!
There's Mereweis! mark, strange work!
And there's the Czar, and there's the Turk!
I do foresee (and for foreseeing
Will equall any Man in being)
The Army ne'er can be disbanded,
I wish the King were safely landed.
The Pope──────An Indian Merchant by
Cutt short the Speech with this reply────
All at a Stand! You see great Changes!
Ah, Sṛ you never saw the Ganges!
There dwell the Nations of Quid──nunc──ies
(So Monomotapa calls Monkies)
On either bank from bough to bough
They meet and chat (as we may now)
Whispers go round, they grin, they shrug,
They bow, they snarl, they scratch, they hug,
And just as chance or whim provokes 'em
They either bite their friends, or stroke 'em.
There have I seen some active Prig
To shew his parts, bestride a Twig,
Lord! how the chattering Tribe admire,
Not that he's wiser, but he's Higher:
All long to try the ventrous thing,
(For Pow'r's, but to have one's Swing)
From Side to Side he springs, he spurns,
And bangs his Foes & Friends by turns,
Thus as in giddy freaks he bounces,
Crack goes the twig, & in he flounces,
Down the swift Stream the wretch is borne,
Never──────ah! never to return!
Z────ds what a fall had Our dear Brother,
Morblieu! crys one, & damme t'other.
The Nations give a general Screech,
None cocks his tail, none claws his breech,
Each trembles for the Publick weal,
And for a while forgets to steal;
A while all Eyes intent and steady,
Pursue him whirling down the Eddy,
But out of mind when out of view,
Some other mounts the Twig anew,
And business on each Monkey Shore,
Runs the same track it went before.Y20-174F
